main.name: Kevin Pruvost
main.description: Hello ! I'm a student in Computer Science passionate about Software Engineering, Computer Graphics and Low-Level Programming
main.bio:
I am a passionate and hardworking developer, with a team working spirit.
I developped an interest through my years of coding in Software Engineering, AI, Game Development, Low Level Programming and Computer Graphics. I'm focusing the rest of my studies on these subjects, and for that, I'm currently preparing myself for a year of studies abroad, in the Tsinghua University, where they teach all of these subjects. For my future career, my ultimate wish is to get a job in of these specialties, in a company with passionate people from every levels of experience, where everybody wants to share their knowledge and where team work is at its best, in terms of fun but also of efficiency.
main.contactmessage: Do not hesitate to contact me, via email or phone call, I'll answer with great pleasure.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: It's my absolute favorite language and also the one I'm the most experienced with. Mainly because of the balance between optimization, complexity and practicality it has. I really enjoy working with this language, and I feel I can do anything I want with this. Having a creative mindset, the possibilities of creation C++ can give fills me with motivation when I work with it.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: It's my second preferred language, it could be seen as pretty contradictory considering that my favorite language is C++ because Python, in terms of complexity and speed of coding, is the opposite of C++. And that's mainly why I like it, when I want to work on small projects meant to be fast to code, I go with Python because of all the shortcuts it gives. The large variety of syntaxic sugars it gives makes it funnier to code.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: C# is the second language I'm the most experienced with. I had an internship wihtin a game/applications company who is using Unity for most of their projects. I made 2 professional projects with this, and having a C++ background and a will to learn more, I got comfortable with the language pretty fast. I think it's a great and easy language to work with.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JS is my favorite web language. Mainly because of how easy it is to start with when you have a background in coding, but also beacause of how fast you can write new code. I had the opportunity to work on the Front-End of some projects, including one during my internships. I also enjoy because of the similarities it has with other languages I love.

skills.description: I used Git for all of my projects, whether it was with companies, for personal projects or for school projects.
